qas.question: The School dismissed claims that Prince Harry was cheating by saying the claims were what?
What was potentially considered abuse of teacher-student confidentiality?

answers.text: Forsyth's decision to record a conversation with Harry

qas.question: The tribunal denied responsibility for what concerning Harry's recording in the Forsyth case?

answers.text: determine whether or not it was legitimate

qas.question: Who was the spokesperson for Clarence House?
Who wrote the text for Prince Harry's expressive art project?
Who was one of the members of the tribunal?
Who issued the statement for the school?

context: It criticised <a1_0><b5_0>Forsyth<b5_0/>'s decision to record a conversation with Harry<a1_0/> as an abuse of teacher–student confidentiality and said "It is clear whichever version of the evidence is accepted that <b3_0><b6_0>Mr Burke<b6_0/><b3_0/> did ask the claimant to assist <b4_0>Prince Harry<b4_0/> with text for his expressive art project ... It is not part of this tribunal's function to <a2_0>determine whether or not it was legitimate<a2_0/>." In response to the tribunal's ruling concerning the allegations about Prince Harry, the School issued a statement, saying Forsyth's claims "were dismissed for what they always have been - <a0_0>unfounded and irrelevant<a0_0/>." A spokesperson from Clarence House said, "We are delighted that Harry has been totally cleared of cheating."
